result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory R Zahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: To be served after jail time ordered in case no. 13-CF-148. Huber privileges granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: 8/24/18 Court amends credit from 213 days to 215 days.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  (see attached assessment report)
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Maintain stable residence.
To pay restitution owing as shown per the Revocation Order and Warrant, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the victims son, Dan E.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory R Zahn

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: (sentence credit) (rec'd by Court 8/10/18). Per Court, please amend JOC to award 215 days of credit, rather than 213 days of credit.
records.descr: DOC Notice of Intent to Modify Sentence

records.addlTxt: DA Response for Sentence Credit Request

of Conviction and Order - ERP.   IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by a DOC records office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original victim is deceased. Estate has designated DE as the new payee.
Email from Dep. Werner in the jail with sentence credit due defendant of 213 days.
from Sentencing Hearing dated 6/21/16

Door County Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests 3 day furlough before beginning his prison sentence. Court denies request. Defendant needs to start his prison sentence and move on with his life. DTE

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court reviews factual errors in PSI.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to order PSI, set off sentencing in this file to the same date as sentencing in 16-CF-29 & 16-CF-45. Court orders PSI, moves sentencing hearing to 6/21/16.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
for Sentence Modification from Door County Jail. Per Court, revoke Huber/Work release for remainder of inmate's incarceration.

for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting 2 day furlough. Per Court, approved. Has a lot of time left, would like him to be working. A reasonable request. Believe he understands all jail rules need to be followed.

for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, approved. 3 day furlough under Jail conditions in order to obtain a job and clear out house. The 6 months remaining on his sentence along with regaining Huber justify this.
Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max penalties.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Pelrine advises he received a victim inpact statement this morning and after reviewing that statement, he'll need to contact victim before proceeding with sentencing. Defense had hoped to proceed to sentencing today but understands that per Statute the victim has the right to be present at sentencing. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 4 & 5. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 4 & 5. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 3 but reads in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State requests Court order PSI. Defense has no objection, still awaiting SAR on another file. Counsel request a sentencing date next week, hope to have the SAR packet by then. Bond remains in effect.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Back on the record. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Defense waives reading of the Information, advises defendant will be entering plea today to resolve matter.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Cory R Zahn in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint. Atty Reetz would like to enter plea after intake this morning. Recess.
from DA's office asking to move Initial Appearance to 12/15/14. Court grants request.
Initial appearance on December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 11/16/14 by jail staff.
No contact direct or indirect with M.E. or his residence, D.E. or his residence, or D.T.

Defendant Cory R Zahn in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court explained process of petition for court appointed counsel.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
